pullRequest.body: Classifies by adding issue number (#10745) to porting notes claiming `was simp`.

nodes.body: :v: pitmonticone can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7979416487/job/21786776129)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7979416487/job/21786775874)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7979416487/job/21786775578)

This looks more like a previous `@[simp]` annotation:
```suggestion
@[deprecated, isROrC_simps] -- porting note (#10618): was `simp` but `simp` can prove it
```
Same for the rest in this file.
This is not quite #10618 but certainly it's a different class of note.
Ok @Vierkantor, I'll remove the issue label.

```suggestion
-- porting note (#10618): was `simp`, now `simp only` proves it
```
